metadata.title: CVE-2021-47215 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/mlx5e: kTLS, Fix crash in RX resync flow For the TLS RX resync flow, wemaintain a list of TLS contexts that require some attention, to communicatetheir resync information to the HW. Here we fix list corruptions, byprotecting the entries against movements coming fromresync_handle_seq_match(), until their resync handling in napi is fullycompleted.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
